title: unknown emission type: `dep-info`
body:
Hi.
I've created a small project : a simple cargo file and a rust file in src/main.rs.
Here is how my files are organized in the project (once cargo build had been run):

```
Cargo.lock  Cargo.toml  src  target

./src:
main.rs

./target:
build  deps  examples  native

./target/build:

./target/deps:

./target/examples:

./target/native:
```
###### Cargo file (Cargo.toml) :

```
[package]

name = "hello_world"
version = "0.0.1"
authors = [ "Simon THOBY <simonthoby@gmail.com>" ]

[[bin]]

name = "hello_world"
```
###### main.rs :

```
fn main() {
    println!("Hello, world!");
}
```

result of cargo build --verbose:

```
[t0b1nux@t0b1nux-arch hw]$  cargo build --verbose
   Compiling hello_world v0.0.1 (file:///home/t0b1nux/dev/rust/hw)
     Running "rustc /home/t0b1nux/dev/rust/hw/src/main.rs --crate-name hello_world --crate-type bin -g --out-dir /home/t0b1nux/dev/rust/hw/target --emit=dep-info,link -L /home/t0b1nux/dev/rust/hw/target -L /home/t0b1nux/dev/rust/hw/target/deps"
error: unknown emission type: "dep-info"
Could not compile "hello_world".

Caused by:
  Process didn't exit successfully: "rustc /home/t0b1nux/dev/rust/hw/src/main.rs --crate-name hello_world --crate-type bin -g --out-dir /home/t0b1nux/dev/rust/hw/target --emit=dep-info,link -L /home/t0b1nux/dev/rust/hw/target -L /home/t0b1nux/dev/rust/hw/target/deps" (status=101)
```

I don't think this is caused by a syntax error but rather in a incompatibility between rust and cargo (because rustc is called with the flag `emit=dep-info,link` that it don't recognize).
I use the rust version in archlinux repos :

```
[t0b1nux@t0b1nux-arch hw]$ pacman -Qi rust
Name           : rust
Version        : 0.12.0-1
Description    : A safe, concurrent, practical language
Architecture   : x86_64
URL            : http://www.rust-lang.org/
Licenses       : MIT  Apache
Groups         : None
Provides       : None
Depends On     : gcc  shared-mime-info
Optional Deps  : None
Required By    : None
Optional For   : None
Conflicts With : None
Replaces       : None
Installed Size : 147.09 MiB
Packager       : Daniel Micay <danielmicay@gmail.com>
Build Date     : Fri 10 Oct 2014 07:31:41 AM CEST
Install Date   : Mon 29 Dec 2014 05:37:13 PM CET
Install Reason : Explicitly installed
Install Script : Yes
Validated By   : Signature
```

Here is some infos about cargo(I've installed nightly build as explained on cargo github page):

```

[t0b1nux@t0b1nux-arch hw]$ cargo --version
cargo 0.0.1-pre-nightly (26ac282 2014-12-30 00:13:39 +0000)
```

Is it an error in cargo ? Have I made an error in my config file ?
